project_description: The Flutter project is a Todo application that follows the Stacked architecture. It allows users to create, view, update, and delete todo items. Users can mark todo items as complete, view due dates, and interact with custom dialogs and bottom sheets.
architecture_overview: The application is structured using the Stacked architecture, which separates the concerns of the application into distinct layers: UI, View Model, and Service. The UI layer consists of the various views and widgets, the View Model layer handles the business logic and state management, and the Service layer manages dependencies and provides access to external resources. This modular design allows for easy addition of new features, services, and UI components.

files.name: lib/app/app.dart
files.description: Defines the app structure using StackedApp annotation for routes, dependencies, bottom sheets, and dialogs. It includes routes (HomeView, StartupView), services (BottomSheetService, DialogService, NavigationService), bottom sheets (NoticeSheet), and dialogs (InfoAlertDialog). The file structure allows for easy addition of new services, routes, bottom sheets, and dialogs using the @stacked-import, @stacked-route, @stacked-service, @stacked-bottom-sheet, and @stacked-dialog annotations.

files.name: lib/app/app.dialogs.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up and managing the custom dialog functionality in the Flutter application. It provides a centralized way to register and use different types of dialogs throughout the app.

methods.name: setupDialogUi
methods.description: Registers the custom dialog builders with the DialogService, allowing the app to display various types of dialogs throughout the UI.

files.name: lib/features/home/widgets/todo_item.dart
files.description: The `TodoItem` widget is responsible for rendering a single to-do item within the home screen of a to-do list application. It displays the title, description, due date (if set), and provides controls to mark the task as complete or delete it.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Constructs the visual representation of the `TodoItem` widget, including the task title, description, due date, and controls to mark the task as complete or delete it.

files.name: lib/models/todo.dart
files.description: This file defines a `Todo` class that represents a task or item in a to-do list application. The `Todo` class encapsulates the essential information and functionality related to a todo item, including its unique identifier, title, description, completion status, creation date, and due date. It provides a set of methods and properties that enable the creation, manipulation, and serialization of todo items, supporting the core functionality of a to-do list application.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class Todo {
  +String id
  +String title
  +String description
  +bool isCompleted
  +DateTime createdAt
  +DateTime? dueDate
  +Todo copyWith()
  +List<Object?> get props
  +Map<String, dynamic> toJson()
  +factory Todo.fromJson(Map<String, dynamic> json)
}
@enduml

methods.name: copyWith
methods.description: Creates a new `Todo` instance with the specified changes, allowing for the modification of individual properties without creating a new object from scratch.

methods.name: get props
methods.description: Returns a list of the object's properties, used for equality comparison and hashing.

methods.name: toJson
methods.description: Converts the `Todo` instance to a JSON-compatible map, enabling serialization and storage of the todo item data.

methods.name: fromJson
methods.description: Creates a new `Todo` instance from a JSON-compatible map, enabling deserialization and reconstruction of todo item data.

files.name: lib/app/app.bottomsheets.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up the custom bottom sheet UI for the application. It defines the different types of bottom sheets that can be used and registers them with the BottomSheetService.

methods.name: setupBottomSheetUi
methods.description: Configures the BottomSheetService with custom sheet builders for each BottomSheetType

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/notice/notice_sheet_model.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines the `NoticeSheetModel` class, which is a view model for a bottom sheet UI component that displays important notices or alerts to the user.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/info_alert/info_alert_dialog_model.dart
files.description: The InfoAlertDialogModel class is a view model that encapsulates the logic and state for an information alert dialog in a Flutter application. This class is responsible for managing the display and behavior of the information alert dialog, which is a common UI component used to provide users with important notifications or messages.

methods.name: InfoAlertDialogModel
methods.description: The constructor for the InfoAlertDialogModel class, which extends the BaseViewModel class from the stacked package.

files.name: lib/ui/common/app_colors.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines a set of constant color values that are used throughout the application's user interface. It serves as a centralized place to manage and access the application's color palette.

files.name: lib/services/todo_service.dart
files.description: This Dart file contains the `TodoService` class, which is responsible for managing the CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on todo items in a Todo application. It serves as the main interface for interacting with the todo-related data and state, abstracting away the underlying data storage and repository logic.

methods.name: get todos
methods.description: Provides access to the list of todo items managed by the service.

methods.name: loadTodos
methods.description: Asynchronously loads the list of todo items from the underlying repository.

methods.name: addTodo
methods.description: Asynchronously adds a new todo item to the repository.

methods.name: toggleTodoStatus
methods.description: Asynchronously updates the completion status of a todo item in the repository.

methods.name: deleteTodo
methods.description: Asynchronously deletes a todo item from the repository.

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/add_todo/add_todo_sheet.dart
files.description: The AddTodoSheet class is responsible for providing a bottom sheet UI component that allows users to create a new todo item. It integrates with the AddTodoForm widget to handle the submission of the todo data and provide it back to the calling context.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the UI for the AddTodoSheet, which includes the title and the AddTodoForm widget.

files.name: lib/features/app/app_viewmodel.dart
files.description: The `AppViewModel` class is responsible for managing the overall state and behavior of the application. It serves as the view model for the main app screen, providing the necessary data and functionality to the UI layer.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description: Initializes the application state and sets up any necessary dependencies or services.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Cleans up and disposes of any resources or subscriptions when the application is terminated.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/confirm_delete/confirm_delete_dialog.dart
files.description: This Dart file defines a reusable `ConfirmDeleteDialog` widget that provides a confirmation dialog for deleting an item. It is responsible for displaying a dialog with a customizable title and description, and handling the user's decision to confirm or cancel the deletion.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Builds the UI of the confirmation dialog, including the title, description, and buttons to confirm or cancel the deletion.

files.name: lib/features/home/widgets/add_todo_form.dart
files.description: The `AddTodoForm` class is responsible for providing a user interface for creating new todo items in a todo list application. It allows the user to input a title, description, and due date for a new todo, and then submits the todo to a callback function provided by the parent component.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Cleans up the text editing controllers when the widget is disposed.

methods.name: _selectDate
methods.description: Displays a date picker dialog and updates the selected due date when the user picks a date.

methods.name: _submitForm
methods.description: Validates the form fields and creates a new Todo instance with the user-provided data, then calls the `onSubmit` callback to pass the new todo to the parent component.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Constructs the UI for the add todo form, including text fields for the title and description, a date picker, and a submit button.

files.name: lib/utils/date_time_utils.dart
files.description: This file provides a set of utility functions for working with dates and times in the application. It offers a consistent way to format dates, times, and date-time values, as well as to perform common operations like checking if two dates are the same day, and getting the start and end of a day.

methods.name: formatDate
methods.description: Formats a given DateTime object as a string in the format 'MMM dd, yyyy'.

methods.name: formatDateTime
methods.description: Formats a given DateTime object as a string in the format 'MMM dd, yyyy hh:mm a'.

methods.name: formatTime
methods.description: Formats a given DateTime object as a string in the format 'hh:mm a'.

methods.name: isSameDay
methods.description: Checks if two given DateTime objects represent the same day.

methods.name: startOfDay
methods.description: Returns a new DateTime object representing the start of the day (00:00:00) for the given DateTime.

methods.name: endOfDay
methods.description: Returns a new DateTime object representing the end of the day (23:59:59) for the given DateTime.

files.name: lib/app/app.locator.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for setting up and managing the dependency injection and service locator in a Flutter/Dart application. It is a core part of the application's architecture, as it allows for the decoupling and management of dependencies between different components.

methods.name: setupLocator
methods.description: This method is responsible for setting up the dependency injection and service locator. It registers the necessary environment and dependencies, ensuring that the application can access the required services throughout its lifetime.

files.name: lib/features/home/home_repository.dart
files.description: The HomeRepository class is responsible for managing the state and operations related to the todo list in a Todo application. It provides the core functionality for loading, adding, updating, and deleting todo items.

methods.name: loadTodos
methods.description: Retrieves the list of todo items. In a real application, this would load the todos from a database or API.

methods.name: addTodo
methods.description: Adds a new todo item to the list.

methods.name: updateTodo
methods.description: Updates an existing todo item in the list.

methods.name: deleteTodo
methods.description: Removes a todo item from the list based on its ID.

files.name: lib/ui/common/ui_helpers.dart
files.description: This Dart file provides a set of utility functions and constants that help with common UI layout and sizing tasks in a Flutter application. It serves as a central location for managing and applying consistent spacing, sizing, and responsive design principles across the application's user interface.
files.class_diagram:
@startuml
class UIHelpers {
  + const double _tinySize
  + const double _smallSize
  + const double _mediumSize
  + const double _largeSize
  + const double _massiveSize

  + const Widget horizontalSpaceTiny
  + const Widget horizontalSpaceSmall
  + const Widget horizontalSpaceMedium
  + const Widget horizontalSpaceLarge

  + const Widget verticalSpaceTiny
  + const Widget verticalSpaceSmall
  + const Widget verticalSpaceMedium
  + const Widget verticalSpaceLarge
  + const Widget verticalSpaceMassive

  + Widget spacedDivider
  + Widget verticalSpace(double height)

  + double screenWidth(BuildContext context)
  + double screenHeight(BuildContext context)
  + double screenHeightFraction(BuildContext context, {int dividedBy = 1, double offsetBy = 0, double max = 3000})
  + double screenWidthFraction(BuildContext context, {int dividedBy = 1, double offsetBy = 0, double max = 3000})
  + double halfScreenWidth(BuildContext context)
  + double thirdScreenWidth(BuildContext context)
  + double quarterScreenWidth(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveHorizontalSpaceMedium(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveSmallFontSize(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveMediumFontSize(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveLargeFontSize(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveExtraLargeFontSize(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveMassiveFontSize(BuildContext context)
  + double getResponsiveFontSize(BuildContext context, {double? fontSize, double? max})
}
@enduml

methods.name: horizontalSpaceTiny
methods.description: A constant Widget that provides a tiny horizontal space.

methods.name: screenWidth
methods.description: Gets the width of the screen in the current BuildContext.

methods.name: screenHeightFraction
methods.description: Gets a fraction of the screen height based on the provided parameters.

methods.name: getResponsiveHorizontalSpaceMedium
methods.description: Gets a responsive horizontal space value based on the screen width.

methods.name: getResponsiveFontSize
methods.description: Gets a responsive font size based on the screen width and provided parameters.

files.name: lib/app/app.router.dart
files.description: This file is responsible for managing the navigation and routing within the Flutter application. It defines the available routes, their associated view widgets, and provides utility methods to navigate between these routes.

methods.name: navigateToHomeView
methods.description: Navigates to the HomeView route

methods.name: navigateToStartupView
methods.description: Navigates to the StartupView route

methods.name: replaceWithHomeView
methods.description: Replaces the current route with the HomeView route

methods.name: replaceWithStartupView

files.name: lib/ui/bottom_sheets/notice/notice_sheet.dart
files.description: The `NoticeSheet` class is responsible for rendering a bottom sheet UI component that displays a notice or announcement to the user. It is part of the UI layer of a Todo application and integrates with the `stacked` and `stacked_services` libraries to manage its state and interact with other parts of the application.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: The `builder` method is responsible for constructing the UI of the `NoticeSheet`. It takes the current `BuildContext`, the `NoticeSheetModel` view model, and an optional child widget as parameters. This method returns the final `Widget` to be displayed in the bottom sheet.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: The `viewModelBuilder` method is responsible for creating the `NoticeSheetModel` view model, which manages the state and logic of the `NoticeSheet`. This method is called by the `StackedView` parent class to initialize the view model.

files.name: lib/ui/dialogs/add_todo/add_todo_dialog.dart
files.description: This Dart file contains the `AddTodoDialog` class, which is responsible for creating a dialog UI for adding a new todo item to a todo list application. It provides the core functionality for managing the creation of new todo items, including validating the input, saving the new todo, and handling the dialog's lifecycle.

methods.name: AddTodoDialog
methods.description: Constructs an `AddTodoDialog` with the provided `DialogRequest` and `completer` callback.

methods.name: builder
methods.description: Builds the UI for the `AddTodoDialog`, including the form fields and buttons for saving or cancelling the new todo.

methods.name: viewModelBuilder
methods.description: Provides an instance of `AddTodoDialogModel` to be used by the `StackedView`.

methods.name: saveTodo
methods.description: Validates the form input and, if valid, saves the new todo and completes the dialog with a `DialogResponse`.

dependencies.name: stacked
dependencies.purpose: Stacked architecture for state management and routing

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
participant AppView
participant StartupView
participant StartupViewModel
participant HomeView
participant HomeViewModel
participant TodoService
participant HomeRepository
participant BottomSheetService
participant DialogService

User -> AppView: Launch app
AppView -> StartupView: Initialize
StartupView -> StartupViewModel: Run startup logic
StartupViewModel -> TodoService: Load todos
TodoService -> HomeRepository: Load todos
HomeRepository -> StartupViewModel: Return todos
StartupViewModel -> HomeView: Navigate to home view
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Initialize
HomeViewModel -> TodoService: Load todos
TodoService -> HomeRepository: Load todos
HomeRepository -> HomeViewModel: Return todos
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI

User -> HomeView: Interact (add, toggle, delete todo)
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Handle user actions
HomeViewModel -> TodoService: Add/Toggle/Delete todo
TodoService -> HomeRepository: Add/Update/Delete todo
HomeRepository -> TodoService: Return updated todos
TodoService -> HomeViewModel: Return updated todos
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI

User -> HomeView: Show dialog
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Request dialog
HomeViewModel -> DialogService: Show dialog
DialogService -> HomeViewModel: Return dialog response
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI

User -> HomeView: Show bottom sheet
HomeView -> HomeViewModel: Request bottom sheet
HomeViewModel -> BottomSheetService: Show bottom sheet
BottomSheetService -> HomeViewModel: Return bottom sheet response
HomeViewModel -> HomeView: Update UI
@enduml
state_management_flow: The application uses the Stacked architecture for state management. The ViewModels (e.g., HomeViewModel, StartupViewModel) handle the business logic and state for their respective views. The ViewModels interact with the TodoService and HomeRepository to manage the todo items. The ViewModels also use the DialogService and BottomSheetService to handle the display and interactions of custom dialogs and bottom sheets. This separation of concerns allows for a modular and testable codebase.
navigation_flow: The application's navigation is managed using the Stacked Router, defined in the app.router.dart file. This file sets up the available routes (HomeView and StartupView) and provides utility methods to navigate between them. The main.dart file sets up the app and runs the AppView, which initializes the Stacked architecture and displays the StartupView. After the startup logic is completed, the StartupViewModel navigates to the HomeView. User interactions within the HomeView, such as opening dialogs or bottom sheets, are handled by the HomeViewModel, which requests the necessary services to display the UI components.
